definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: And this from a man who, quite recently, could not trap a bag of suet.
sentences.chinese: 這都源於這個剛剛丟棄了板油包袱的男人。

sentences.english: Beside it, half buried in dirt, was a discarded banner.
sentences.chinese: 在它旁邊，一條丟棄的橫幅半埋於污泥中。

sentences.english: Following the meal, food containers are discarded in the trash compartment below the mid-deck floor.
sentences.chinese: 飯後，食物盒被丟棄在中隔艙地板下的廢物間。

sentences.english: Abandon unnecessary guilt. It's extra baggage you don't need to carry.
sentences.chinese: 丟棄無由得愧咎，別讓它成爲你的沉重包袱。

sentences.english: A message from %1 was dropped, because it contained a blacklisted word.
sentences.chinese: 送來的訊息已被丟棄，因爲包含被擋掉的字眼。

sentences.english: Memory is the hour of clothes, though no longer lares and useful.
sentences.chinese: 回憶是小時後的衣服，捨不得丟棄，雖已不再有用。

sentences.english: Thus, the program avoids the overhead of constantly throwing away and re-creating threads.
sentences.chinese: 因此，該程序避免了不斷丟棄並重新創建線程的過程。

sentences.english: I teach the shepherds that they mustn't throw their wool away.
sentences.chinese: 現在我又回來了，我教牧民們不要把羊毛丟棄掉。

sentences.english: And for one kilogram of Chinese leaves, half would be discarded before packaging.
sentences.chinese: 一千克的大白菜，在包裝之前，一半會被丟棄。

sentences.english: You have to discard any thoughts of disbanding.
sentences.chinese: 你必須丟棄一切解散軍隊的念頭。

sentences.english: Worms reject the finer particles when feeding.
sentences.chinese: 蚯蚓取食時丟棄了較細的顆粒。

sentences.english: The stolen car was dumped in one of the streets.
sentences.chinese: 被盜的汽車被丟棄在一條街上。

sentences.english: It must have seemed the logical place to abandon the trains which were no longer needed.
sentences.chinese: 它似乎成了丟棄廢置火車的理想之地。

sentences.english: Having conquered the target, they discard it, withdraw and move on heartlessly.
sentences.chinese: 一旦征服了目標，他們就會丟棄它，無情地離開。

sentences.english: If the TTL reaches zero the packet is discarded.
sentences.chinese: 如果TTL的值達到零，則該數據包被丟棄。

definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
